Adaptability.description: Plant a precise strike. Mark Stress. Mark 1 Stress
Adaptability.name: Mark Stress

Charge.description: Spin up a burst of speed. Damage. Mark 1 Stress to deal d12 Magical damage
Charge.name: Damage

Danger_Sense.description: Plant a precise strike. Mark Stress. Mark 1 Stress to range veryClose
Danger_Sense.name: Mark Stress

Death_Connection.description: Spin up a burst of speed. Extract. Mark 1 Stress
Death_Connection.name: Extract

Elemental_Breath.description: Choose an element for your breath (such as electricity, fire, or ice). You can use this breath against a target or group of targets within Very Close range, treating it as an Instinct weapon that deals d8 magic damage using your Proficiency.
Elemental_Breath.name: Attack

Fearless.description: Plant a precise strike. Mark Stress. Mark 2 Stress
Fearless.name: Mark Stress

Feline_Instincts.description: Lash out with a flash of steel. Spend Hope. Spend 2 Hope
Feline_Instincts.name: Spend Hope

Fungril_Network.description: Slip in a cutting remark. Communicate. trigger the effect
Fungril_Network.name: Communicate

Increased_Fortitude.description: Lash out with a flash of steel. Spend Hope. Spend 3 Hope
Increased_Fortitude.name: Spend Hope

Kick.description: Spin up a burst of speed. Damage. deal d6 damage
Kick.name: Damage

Long_Tongue.description: Barrel in like a raging bull. Attack. Mark 1 Stress to deal d12 damage
Long_Tongue.name: Attack

Luckbender.description: Slip in a cutting remark. Use. Spend 3 Hope to range close
Luckbender.name: Use

Luckbringer.description: Deliver a clean blow. Gain Hope. deal d6 damage
Luckbringer.name: Gain Hope

Quick_Reactions.description: Plant a precise strike. Mark Stress. Mark 1 Stress
Quick_Reactions.name: Mark Stress

Retracting_Claws.description: Cast a quick feint. Scratch. trigger the effect
Retracting_Claws.name: Scratch

Retract.description: Plant a precise strike. Mark Stress. trigger the effect
Retract.name: Mark Stress

Tusks.description: Lash out with a flash of steel. Spend Hope. Spend 1 Hope
Tusks.name: Spend Hope

Unshakeable.description: Slip in a cutting remark. Use. trigger the effect
Unshakeable.name: Use

Wings.description: Plant a precise strike. Mark Stress. Mark 1 Stress
Wings.name: Mark Stress

Agile.description: Lash out with a flash of steel. Spend Hope. Spend 1 Hope
Agile.name: Spend Hope

Armored_Shell.description: Mark an Armor Slot to retract into your shell. While in your shell, physical damage is reduced by a number equal to your Armor Score (after applying resistance), but you can’t perform other actions without leaving this form.
Armored_Shell.name: Retract

Bird_s_Eye_View.description: Once per rest while you are airborne, you can ask the GM a question about the scene below you without needing to roll. The first time a character makes a roll to act on this information, they gain advantage on the roll.
Bird_s_Eye_View.name: Ask Question

Cannonball:Cannonball.description: Mark a Stress to allow an ally to throw or launch you at an adversary. To do so, the ally makes an attack roll using Agility or Strength (their choice) against a target within Close range. On a success, the adversary takes d12+2 physical damage using the thrower’s Proficiency.
Cannonball:Cannonball.name: Cannonball

Cannonball:Spend Hope.description: You can spend a Hope to target an additional adversary within Very Close range of the first. The second target takes half the damage dealt to the first target.
Cannonball:Spend Hope.name: Spend Hope

Demolish.description: Spend a Hope to move up to Far range in a straight line and make an attack against all targets within Melee range of the line. Targets you succeed against take d8+10 physical damage using your Proficiency and are temporarily Vulnerable.
Demolish.name: Attack

Devastating_Strikes.description: When you deal Severe damage to a target within Melee range, you can mark a Stress to force them to mark an additional Hit Point.
Devastating_Strikes.name: Mark Stress

Elusive_Prey.description: Plant a precise strike. Mark Stress. Mark 1 Stress
Elusive_Prey.name: Mark Stress

Fleet.description: Spend a Hope to move up to Far range without rolling.
Fleet.name: Move

Hobbling_Strike.description: Plant a precise strike. Mark Stress. Mark 1 Stress
Hobbling_Strike.name: Mark Stress

Ocean_Master.description: When you succeed on an attack against a target within Melee range, you can temporarily Restrain them.
Ocean_Master.name: Restrain

Rampage.description: Before you make an attack roll, you can mark a Stress to gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency for that attack.
Rampage.name: Gain Proficiency

Snapping_Strike.description: When you succeed on an attack against a target within Melee range, you can spend a Hope to clamp that opponent in your jaws, making them temporarily Restrained and Vulnerable.
Snapping_Strike.name: Spend Hope

Takedown.description: Mark a Stress to move into Melee range of a target and make an attack roll against them. On a success, you gain a +2 bonus to your Proficiency for this attack and the target must mark a Stress.
Takedown.name: Attack

Trample.description: Mark a Stress to move up to Close range in a straight line and make an attack against all targets within Melee range of the line. Targets you succeed against take d8+1 physical damage using your Proficiency and are temporarily Vulnerable.
Trample.name: Attack

Unyielding.description: When you would mark an Armor Slot, roll a d6. On a result of 5 or higher, reduce the severity by one threshold without marking an Armor Slot.
Unyielding.name: Roll d6

Venomous_Bite.description: Unleash a storm of force. Poison. range melee
Venomous_Bite.name: Poison

Venomous_Strike.description: Make an attack against any number of targets within Very Close range. On a success, a target is temporarily Poisoned. A Poisoned creature takes 1d10 physical direct damage each time they act.
Venomous_Strike.name: Attack

Vicious_Maul.description: When you succeed on an attack against a target within Melee range, you can spend a Hope to clamp that opponent in your jaws, making them temporarily Restrained and Vulnerable.
Vicious_Maul.name: Spend Hope

Warning_Hiss.description: Mark a Stress to force any number of targets within Melee range to move back to Very Close range.
Warning_Hiss.name: Mark Stress

Webslinger.description: Barrel in like a raging bull. Restrain. trigger the effect
Webslinger.name: Restrain

Beastform.description: Deliver a clean blow. Beastform. Mark 1 Stress
Beastform.name: Beastform

Channel_Raw_Power.description:
Once per long rest, you can place a domain card from your loadout into your vault and choose to either:

  • Gain Hope equal to the level of the card.

  • Enhance a spell that deals damage, gaining a bonus to your damage roll equal to twice the level of the card.
Channel_Raw_Power.name: Channel

Evolution.description: Spend 3 Hope to transform into a Beastform without marking a Stress. When you do, choose one trait to raise by +1 until you drop out of that Beastform.
Evolution.name: Beastform

Hold_Them_Off.description: Spend 3 Hope when you succeed on an attack with a weapon to use that same roll against two additional adversaries within range of the attack.
Hold_Them_Off.name: Spend Hope

Life_Support.description: Spend 3 Hope to clear a Hit Point on an ally within Close range.
Life_Support.name: Healing

Make_a_Scene.description: Lash out with a flash of steel. Spend Hope. Spend 3 Hope
Make_a_Scene.name: Spend Hope

Minor_Illusion.description: Spin up a burst of speed. Cast. trigger the effect
Minor_Illusion.name: Cast

Not_This_Time.description: Spend 3 Hope to force an adversary within Far range to reroll an attack or damage roll.
Not_This_Time.name: Spend Hope

No_Mercy.description: Spend 3 Hope to gain a +1 bonus to your attack rolls until your next rest.
No_Mercy.name: Spend Hope

Rally.description: Let loose a flare of power. Rally Your Allies!. trigger the effect
Rally.name: Rally your allies!

Rally__Level_5_.description: Channel a surge of will. Rally Your Allies. trigger the effect
Rally__Level_5_.name: Rally your Allies

Ranger_s_Focus.description:
Spend a Hope and make an attack against a target. On a success, deal your attack’s normal damage and temporarily make the attack’s target your Focus. Until this feature ends or you make a different creature your Focus, you gain the following benefits against your Focus:

  • You know precisely what direction they are in.

  • When you deal damage to them, they must mark a Stress.

  • When you fail an attack against them, you can end your Ranger’s Focus feature to reroll your Duality Dice.
Ranger_s_Focus.name: Spend Hope

Rogue_s_Dodge.description: Spend 3 Hope to gain a +2 bonus to your Evasion until the next time an attack succeeds against you. Otherwise, this bonus lasts until your next rest.
Rogue_s_Dodge.name: Spend Hope

Sneak_Attack.description:
When you succeed on an attack while Cloaked or while an ally is within Melee range of your target, add a number of d6s equal to your tier to your damage roll.

  • Level 1 -> Tier 1

  • Levels 2–4 -> Tier 2

  • Levels 5–7 -> Tier 3

  • Levels 8–10 -> Tier 4
Sneak_Attack.name: Use Sneak Attack

Strange_Patterns.description:
Choose a number between 1 and 12. When you roll that number on a Duality Die, gain a Hope or clear a Stress.

You can change this number when you take a long rest.
Strange_Patterns.name: Clear Stress

Volatile_Magic.description: Spend 3 Hope to reroll any number of your damage dice on an attack that deals magic damage.
Volatile_Magic.name: Spend 3 Hope

Dedicated.description: Record three sayings or values your upbringing instilled in you. Once per rest, when you describe how you’re embodying one of these principles through your current action, you can roll a d20 as your Hope Die
Dedicated.name: Use

Nomadic_Pack.description: Cast a quick feint. Pull Item. Spend 1 Hope
Nomadic_Pack.name: Pull Item

Act_of_Reprisal.description: When an adversary damages an ally within Melee range, you gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency for the next successful attack you make against that adversary.
Act_of_Reprisal.name: Mark Adversary

Adept.description: When you Utilize an Experience, you can mark a Stress instead of spending a Hope. If you do, double your Experience modifier for that roll.
Adept.name: Mark Stress

Adrenaline.description: While you're Vulnerable, add your level to your damage rolls.
Adrenaline.name: Apply

Apex_Predator.description: Before you make an attack roll against your Focus, you can spend a Hope. On a successful attack, you remove a Fear from the GM’s Fear pool.
Apex_Predator.name: Spend Hope

Battle_Ritual.description: Once per long rest, before you attempt something incredibly dangerous or face off against a foe who clearly outmatches you, describe what ritual you perform or preparations you make. When you do, clear 2 Stress and gain 2 Hope.
Battle_Ritual.name: Prepare

Clarity_of_Nature.description: Once per long rest, you can create a space of natural serenity within Close range. When you spend a few minutes resting within the space, clear Stress equal to your Instinct, distributed as you choose between you and your allies.
Clarity_of_Nature.name: Clear Stress

Comaraderie.description: You can initiate a Tag Team Roll one additional time per session.
Comaraderie.name: Comaraderie

Contacts_Everywhere.description:
Once per session, you can briefly call on a shady contact. Choose one of the following benefits and describe what brought them here to help you in this moment:

  • They provide 1 handful of gold, a unique tool, or a mundane object that the situation requires.

  • On your next action roll, their help provides a +3 bonus to the result of your Hope or Fear Die.

  • The next time you deal damage, they snipe from the shadows, adding 2d8 to your damage roll.
Contacts_Everywhere.name: Use Feature

Dark_Cloud.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll (15). On a success, create a temporary dark cloud that covers any area within Close range. Anyone in this cloud can’t see outside of it, and anyone outside of it can’t see in. You’re considered Cloaked from any adversary for whom the cloud blocks line of sight.

@Template[type:emanation|range:c]
Dark_Cloud.name: SpellCast: Dark Cloud

Defender.description: When you’re in Beastform and an ally within Close range marks 2 or more Hit Points, you can mark a Stress to reduce the number of Hit Points they mark by 1.
Defender.name: Mark Stress

Elementalist:Bonus to Roll.description: Spend a Hope and describe how your control over this element helps an action roll you’re about to make, gain a +2 bonus to the roll.
Elementalist:Bonus to Roll.name: Bonus to Roll

Elementalist:Bonus to Damage.description: Spend a Hope and describe how your control over this element helps an action roll you’re about to make, gain a +3 bonus to the roll’s damage.
Elementalist:Bonus to Damage.name: Bonus to Damage

Elemental_Aura:Fire.description: When an adversary marks 1 or more Hit Points, they must also mark a Stress.
Elemental_Aura:Fire.name: Fire

Elemental_Aura:Earth.description: When an adversary marks 1 or more Hit Points, they must also mark a Stress.
Elemental_Aura:Earth.name: Earth

Elemental_Aura:Water.description: When an adversary deals damage to you, you can mark a Stress to move them anywhere within Very Close range of where they are.
Elemental_Aura:Water.name: Water

Elemental_Aura:Air.description: When you or an ally takes damage from an attack beyond Melee range, reduce the damage by 1d8.
Elemental_Aura:Air.name: Air

Elemental_Dominion:Fire.description: You gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency for attacks and spells that deal damage.
Elemental_Dominion:Fire.name: Fire

Elemental_Dominion:Earth.description: When you would mark Hit Points, roll a d6 per Hit Point marked. For each result of 6, reduce the number of Hit Points you mark by 1.
Elemental_Dominion:Earth.name: Earth

Elemental_Dominion:Water.description: When an attack against you succeeds, you can mark a Stress to make the attacker temporarily Vulnerable.
Elemental_Dominion:Water.name: Water

Elemental_Dominion:Air.description: You gain a +1 bonus to your Evasion and can fly.
Elemental_Dominion:Air.name: Air

Elemental_Incarnation:Fire.description: When an adversary within Melee range deals damage to you, they take @Damage[type:magical|value:1d10].
Elemental_Incarnation:Fire.name: Fire

Elemental_Incarnation:Earth.description: Gain a bonus to your damage thresholds equal to your Proficiency.
Elemental_Incarnation:Earth.name: Earth

Elemental_Incarnation:Water.description:
When you deal damage to an adversary within Melee range, all other adversaries within Very Close range must mark a Stress.

@Template[type:emanation|range:vc]
Elemental_Incarnation:Water.name: Water

Elemental_Incarnation:Air.description: You can hover, gaining advantage on Agility Rolls.
Elemental_Incarnation:Air.name: Air

Eloquent.description: Channel a surge of will. Use Feature. trigger the effect
Eloquent.name: Use Feature

Enchanted_Aid.description: Once per long rest, after an ally has made a Spellcast Roll with your help, you can swap the results of their Duality Dice.
Enchanted_Aid.name: Swap Dice Results

Gifted_Performer:Relaxing Song.description: You and all allies within Close range clear a Hit Point.
Gifted_Performer:Relaxing Song.name: Relaxing Song

Gifted_Performer:Heartbreaking Song.description: You and all allies within Close range gain a Hope.
Gifted_Performer:Heartbreaking Song.name: Heartbreaking Song

Heart_of_a_Poet.description: After you make an action roll to impress, persuade, or offend someone, you can spend a Hope to add a [[/r d4]] to the roll.
Heart_of_a_Poet.name: Spend Hope

Honed_Expertise.description: When you use an Experience, roll a d6. On a result of 5 or higher, you can use it without spending Hope.
Honed_Expertise.name: Roll d6

Loyal_Friend.description: Once per long rest, when the damage from an attack would mark your companion’s last Stress or your last Hit Point and you’re within Close range of each other, you or your companion can rush to the other’s side and take that damage instead.
Loyal_Friend.name: Rush

Loyal_Protector.description: When an ally within Close range has 2 or fewer Hit Points and would take damage, you can mark a Stress to sprint to their side and take the damage instead.
Loyal_Protector.name: Mark Stress

Manipulate_Magic.description:
Your primal origin allows you to modify the essence of magic itself. After you cast a spell or make an attack using a weapon that deals magic damage, you can mark a Stress to do one of the following:

  • Extend the spell or attack’s reach by one range

  • Gain a +2 bonus to the action roll’s result

  • Double a damage die of your choice

  • Hit an additional target within range
Manipulate_Magic.name: Manipulate

Natural_Evasion.description: You can call forth your element to protect you from harm. When an attack roll against you succeeds, you can mark a Stress and describe how you use your element to defend you. When you do, roll a d6 and add its result to your Evasion against the attack.
Natural_Evasion.name: Evade

Nemesis.description: Spend 2 Hope to Prioritize an adversary until your next rest. When you make an attack against your Prioritized adversary, you can swap the results of your Hope and Fear Dice. You can only Prioritize one adversary at a time.
Nemesis.name: Spend Hope

Partner_in_Arms.description: When an ally within Very Close range takes damage, you can mark an Armor Slot to reduce the severity by one threshold.
Partner_in_Arms.name: Mark Armor Slot

Perfect_Recall.description: Once per rest, when you recall a domain card in your vault, you can reduce its Recall Cost by 1.
Perfect_Recall.name: Recall

Regeneration.description: Touch a creature and spend 3 Hope. That creature clears 1d4 Hit Points.
Regeneration.name: Heal a creature

Revenge.description: When an adversary within Melee range succeeds on an attack against you, you can mark 2 Stress to force the attacker to mark a Hit Point.
Revenge.name: Mark Stress

Rousing_Speech.description: Once per long rest, you can give a heartfelt, inspiring speech. All allies within Far range clear 2 Stress.
Rousing_Speech.name: Talk to your allies!

Ruthless_Predator.description: When you make a damage roll, you can mark a Stress to gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency. Additionally, when you deal Severe damage to an adversary, they must mark a Stress.
Ruthless_Predator.name: Mark Stress

Shadow_Stepper.description: You can move from shadow to shadow. When you move into an area of darkness or a shadow cast by another creature or object, you can mark a Stress to disappear from where you are and reappear inside another shadow within Far range. When you reappear, you are Cloaked.
Shadow_Stepper.name: Mark Stress

Sparing_Touch:Clear Hit Points.description: Once per long rest, touch a creature and clear 2 Hit Points or 2 Stress from them.
Sparing_Touch:Clear Hit Points.name: Clear Hit Points

Sparing_Touch:Clear Stress.description: Once per long rest, touch a creature and clear 2 Hit Points or 2 Stress from them.
Sparing_Touch:Clear Stress.name: Clear Stress

Spirit_Weapon.description: You can mark a Stress to target an additional adversary within range with the same attack roll.
Spirit_Weapon.name: Target Additional Adversary

Thrive_in_Chaos.description: When you succeed on an attack, you can mark a Stress after rolling damage to force the target to mark an additional Hit Point.
Thrive_in_Chaos.name: Mark Stress

Transcendence.description:
Once per long rest, you can transform into a physical manifestation of your element. When you do, describe your transformation and choose two of the following benefits to gain until your next rest:

  • +4 bonus to your Severe threshold

  • +1 bonus to a character trait of your choice

  • +1 bonus to your Proficiency

  • +2 bonus to your Evasion
Transcendence.name: Transform

Vanishing_Act.description: Mark a Stress to become Cloaked at any time. When Cloaked from this feature, you automatically clear the Restrained condition if you have it. You remain Cloaked in this way until you roll with Fear or until your next rest.
Vanishing_Act.name: Mark Stress

Warden_s_Protection.description: Once per long rest, spend 2 Hope to clear 2 Hit Points on [[/r 1d4]] allies within Close range.
Warden_s_Protection.name: Healing

Weapon_Specialist:Spend Hope.description: You can wield multiple weapons with dangerous ease. When you succeed on an attack, you can spend a Hope to add one of the damage dice from your secondary weapon to the damage roll.
Weapon_Specialist:Spend Hope.name: Spend Hope

Weapon_Specialist:Reroll.description: Additionally, once per long rest when you roll your Slayer Dice, reroll any 1s.
Weapon_Specialist:Reroll.name: Reroll

Wings_of_Light:Mark Stress.description: Mark a Stress to pick up and carry another willing creature approximately your size or smaller.
Wings_of_Light:Mark Stress.name: Mark Stress

Wings_of_Light:Spend Hope.description: Spend a Hope to deal an extra 1d8 damage on a successful attack.
Wings_of_Light:Spend Hope.name: Spend Hope

Adjust_Reality.description: After you or a willing ally make any roll, you can spend 5 Hope to change the numerical result of that roll to a result of your choice instead. The result must be plausible within the range of the dice.
Adjust_Reality.name: Spend Hope

Arcana_Touched.description: Once per rest, you can switch the results of your Hope and Fear Dice.
Arcana_Touched.name: Switch Duality Results

Arcane_Reflection.description: When you would take magic damage, you can spend any number of Hope to roll that many d6s. If any roll a 6, the attack is reflected back to the caster, dealing the damage to them instead.
Arcane_Reflection.name: Reflect Back

Armorer.description: During a rest, when you choose to repair your armor as a downtime move, your allies also clear an Armor Slot.
Armorer.name: Repair Armor

Astral_Projection.description:
Once per long rest, mark a Stress to create a projected copy of yourself that can appear anywhere you’ve been before.

You can see and hear through the projection as though it were you and affect the world as though you were there. A creature investigating the projection can tell it’s of magical origin. This effect lasts until your next rest or your projection takes any damage.
Astral_Projection.name: Project

A_Soldier_s_Bond.description: Once per long rest, when you compliment someone or ask them about something they’re good at, you can both gain 3 Hope.
A_Soldier_s_Bond.name: Gain 3 Hope

Banish.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Close range. On a success, roll a number of d20s equal to your Spellcast trait. The target must make a reaction roll with a Difficulty equal to your highest result. On a success, the target must mark a Stress but isn’t banished. Once per rest on a failure, they are banished from this realm.

When the PCs roll with Fear, the Difficulty gains a −1 penalty and the target makes another reaction roll. On a success, they return from banishment.
Banish.name: Spellcast Roll

Battle_Cry.description: Once per long rest, while you’re charging into danger, you can muster a rousing call that inspires your allies. All allies who can hear you each clear a Stress and gain a Hope. Additionally, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls until you or an ally rolls a failure with Fear.
Battle_Cry.name: Clear Stress & Gain Hope

Battle_Hardened.description: Once per long rest when you would make a Death Move, you can spend a Hope to clear a Hit Point instead.
Battle_Hardened.name: Spend a Hope

Battle_Monster.description: When you make a successful attack against an adversary, you can mark 4 Stress to force the target to mark a number of Hit Points equal to the number of Hit Points you currently have marked instead of rolling for damage.
Battle_Monster.name: Mark 4 Stress

Blink_Out.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (12). On a success, spend a Hope to teleport to another point you can see within Far range. If any willing creatures are within Very Close range, spend an additional Hope for each creature to bring them with you.
Blink_Out.name: Teleport

Bold_Presence:Spend Hope.description: When you make a Presence Roll, you can spend a Hope to add your Strength to the roll.
Bold_Presence:Spend Hope.name: Spend Hope

Bold_Presence:Avoid Condition.description: Additionally, once per rest when you would gain a condition, you can describe how your bold presence aids you in the situation and avoid gaining the condition.
Bold_Presence:Avoid Condition.name: Avoid Condition

Bolt_Beacon.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Far range. On a success, spend a Hope to send a bolt of shimmering light toward them, dealing d8+2 magic damage using your Proficiency. The target becomes temporarily Vulnerable and glows brightly until this condition is cleared.
Bolt_Beacon.name: Cast

Bone_Touched.description: Once per rest, you can spend 3 Hope to cause an attack that succeeded against you to fail instead.
Bone_Touched.name: Spend Hope

Book_of_Ava:Power Push.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Melee range. On a success, they’re knocked back to Far range and take d10+2 magic damage using your Proficiency.
Book_of_Ava:Power Push.name: Power Push

Book_of_Ava:Tava's Armor.description: Spend a Hope to give a target you can touch a +1 bonus to their Armor Score until their next rest or you cast Tava’s Armor again.
Book_of_Ava:Tava's Armor.name: Tava's Armor

Book_of_Ava:Ice Spike.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (12) to summon a large ice spike within Far range. If you use it as a weapon, make the Spellcast Roll against the target’s Difficulty instead. On a success, deal d6 physical damage using your Proficiency.
Book_of_Ava:Ice Spike.name: Ice Spike

Book_of_Ava:Ice Spike (Attack).description: Make a Spellcast Roll (12) to summon a large ice spike within Far range. If you use it as a weapon, make the Spellcast Roll against the target’s Difficulty instead. On a success, deal d6 physical damage using your Proficiency.
Book_of_Ava:Ice Spike (Attack).name: Ice Spike (Attack)

Book_of_Exota:Repudiate.description: You can interrupt a magical effect taking place. Make a reaction roll using your Spellcast trait. Once per rest on a success, the effect stops and any consequences are avoided.
Book_of_Exota:Repudiate.name: Repudiate

Book_of_Exota:Create Construct.description: Spend a Hope to choose a group of objects around you and create an animated construct from them that obeys basic commands.
Book_of_Exota:Create Construct.name: Create Construct

Book_of_Exota:Construct (Take Action).description: Make a Spellcast Roll to command the constructs to take action. When necessary, they share your Evasion and traits and their attacks deal 2d10+3 physical damage. You can only maintain one construct at a time, and they fall apart when they take any amount of damage.
Book_of_Exota:Construct (Take Action).name: Construct (Take Action)

Book_of_Grynn:Arcane Deflection.description: Once per long rest, spend a Hope to negate the damage of an attack targeting you or an ally within Very Close range.
Book_of_Grynn:Arcane Deflection.name: Arcane Deflection

Book_of_Grynn:Time Lock.description: Target an object within Far range. That object stops in time and space exactly where it is until your next rest. If a creature tries to move it, make a Spellcast Roll against them to maintain this spell.
Book_of_Grynn:Time Lock.name: Time Lock

Book_of_Grynn:Wall Of Flame.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll (15). On a success, create a wall of magical flame between two points within Far range. All creatures in its path must choose a side to be on, and anything that subsequently passes through the wall takes 4d10+3 magic damage.

@Template[type:ray|range:f]
Book_of_Grynn:Wall Of Flame.name: Wall Of Flame

Book_of_Homet:Pass Through.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (13). Once per rest on a success, you and all creatures touching you can pass through a wall or door within Close range. The effect ends once everyone is on the other side.
Book_of_Homet:Pass Through.name: Pass Through

Book_of_Homet:Plane Gate.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (14). Once per long rest on a success, open a gateway to a location in another dimension or plane of existence you’ve been to before. This gateway lasts until your next rest.
Book_of_Homet:Plane Gate.name: Plane Gate

Book_of_Illiat:Slumber.description: Slumber: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Very Close range. On a success, they’re Asleep until they take damage or the GM spends a Fear on their turn to clear this condition.
Book_of_Illiat:Slumber.name: Slumber

Book_of_Illiat:Arcane Barrage.description: Once per rest, spend any number of Hope and shoot magical projectiles that strike a target of your choice within Close range. Roll a number of d6s equal to the Hope spent and deal that much magic damage to the target.
Book_of_Illiat:Arcane Barrage.name: Arcane Barrage

Book_of_Illiat:Telepathy.description: Spend a Hope to open a line of mental communication with one target you can see. This connection lasts until your next rest or you cast Telepathy again.
Book_of_Illiat:Telepathy.name: Telepathy

Book_of_Korvax:Levitation.description: Make a Spellcast Roll to temporarily lift a target you can see up into the air and move them within Close range of their original position.
Book_of_Korvax:Levitation.name: Levitation

Book_of_Korvax:Recant.description: Spend a Hope to force a target within Melee range to make a Reaction Roll (15). On a failure, they forget the last minute of your conversation.
Book_of_Korvax:Recant.name: Recant

Book_of_Korvax:Rune Circle.description:
Mark a Stress to create a temporary magical circle on the ground where you stand. All adversaries within Melee range, or who enter Melee range, take 2d12+4 magic damage and are knocked back to Very Close range.

@Template[type:emanation|range:m]
Book_of_Korvax:Rune Circle.name: Rune Circle

Book_of_Norai:Mystic Tether.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Far range. On a success, they’re temporarily Restrained and must mark a Stress. If you target a flying creature, this spell grounds and temporarily Restrains them.
Book_of_Norai:Mystic Tether.name: Mystic Tether

Book_of_Norai:Fireball.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Very Far range. On a success, hurl a sphere of fire toward them that explodes on impact. The target and all creatures within Very Close range of them must make a Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail take d20+5 magic damage using your Proficiency. Targets who succeed take half damage.

@Template[type:emanation|range:vc]
Book_of_Norai:Fireball.name: Fireball

Book_of_Ronin:Transform.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (15). On a success, transform into an inanimate object no larger than twice your normal size. You can remain in this shape until you take damage.
Book_of_Ronin:Transform.name: Transform

Book_of_Ronin:Eternal Enervation.description: Once per long rest, make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Close range. On a success, they become permanently Vulnerable. They can’t clear this condition by any means.
Book_of_Ronin:Eternal Enervation.name: Eternal Enervation

Book_of_Sitil:Adjust Appearance.description: You magically shift your appearance and clothing to avoid recognition.
Book_of_Sitil:Adjust Appearance.name: Adjust Appearance

Book_of_Sitil:Parallela.description: Spend 2 Hope to cast this spell on yourself or an ally within Close range. The next time the target makes an attack, they can hit an additional target within range that their attack roll would succeed against. You can only hold this spell on one creature at a time.
Book_of_Sitil:Parallela.name: Parallela

Book_of_Sitil:Illusion.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (14). On a success, create a temporary visual illusion no larger than you within Close range that lasts for as long as you look at it. It holds up to scrutiny until an observer is within Melee range.
Book_of_Sitil:Illusion.name: Illusion

Book_of_Tyfar:Wild Flame.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against up to three adversaries within Melee range. Targets you succeed against take 2d6 magic damage and must mark a Stress as flames erupt from your hand.
Book_of_Tyfar:Wild Flame.name: Wild Flame

Book_of_Tyfar:Magic Hand.description: You conjure a magical hand with the same size and strength as your own within Far range.
Book_of_Tyfar:Magic Hand.name: Magic Hand

Book_of_Tyfar:Mysterious Mist.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll (13) to cast a temporary thick fog that gathers in a stationary area within Very Close range. The fog heavily obscures this area and everything in it.

@Template[type:emanation|range:vc]
Book_of_Tyfar:Mysterious Mist.name: Mysterious Mist

Book_of_Vagras:Runic Lock.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (15) on an object you’re touching that can close (such as a lock, chest, or box). Once per rest on a success, you can lock the object so it can only be opened by creatures of your choice. Someone with access to magic and an hour of time to study the spell can break it.
Book_of_Vagras:Runic Lock.name: Runic Lock

Book_of_Vagras:Arcane Door.description: When you have no adversaries within Melee range, make a Spellcast Roll (13). On a success, spend a Hope to create a portal from where you are to a point within Far range you can see. It closes once a creature has passed through it.
Book_of_Vagras:Arcane Door.name: Arcane Door

Book_of_Vagras:Reveal.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll. If there is anything magically hidden within Close range the roll would succeed against, it is revealed.

@Template[type:emanation|range:c]
Book_of_Vagras:Reveal.name: Reveal

Book_of_Vyola:Memory Delve.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Far range. On a success, peer into the target’s mind and ask the GM a question. The GM describes any memories the target has pertaining to the answer.
Book_of_Vyola:Memory Delve.name: Memory Delve

Book_of_Vyola:Shared Clarity.description: Once per long rest, spend a Hope to choose two willing creatures. When one of them would mark Stress, they can choose between the two of them who marks it. This spell lasts until their next rest.
Book_of_Vyola:Shared Clarity.name: Shared Clarity

Book_of_Yarrow:Timejammer.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll (18). On a success, time temporarily slows to a halt for everyone within Far range except for you. It resumes the next time you make an action roll that targets another creature.

@Template[type:emanation|range:f]
Book_of_Yarrow:Timejammer.name: Timejammer

Book_of_Yarrow:Magic Immunity.description: Spend 5 Hope to become immune to magic damage until your next rest.
Book_of_Yarrow:Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity

Boost.description: Mark a Stress to boost off a willing ally within Close range, fling yourself into the air, and perform an aerial attack against a target within Far range. You have advantage on the attack, add a d10 to the damage roll, and end your move within Melee range of the target.
Boost.name: Mark Stress

Breaking_Blow.description: When you make a successful attack, you can mark a Stress to make the next successful attack against that same target deal an extra 2d12 damage.
Breaking_Blow.name: Mark Stress

Chain_Lightning:Cast.description: Mark 2 Stress to make a Spellcast Roll, unleashing lightning on all targets within Close range. Targets you succeed against must make a reaction roll with a Difficulty equal to the result of your Spellcast Roll. Targets who fail take 2d8+4 magic damage.
Chain_Lightning:Cast.name: Cast

Chain_Lightning:Chain Damage.description: Additional adversaries not already targeted by Chain Lightning and within Close range of previous targets who took damage must also make the reaction roll. Targets who fail take 2d8+4 magic damage. This chain continues until there are no more adversaries within range.
Chain_Lightning:Chain Damage.name: Chain Damage

Champion_s_Edge:Clear 1 HP.description:
When you critically succeed on an attack, you can spend up to 3 Hope and choose one of the following options for each Hope spent:

  • You clear a Hit Point.

  • You clear an Armor Slot.

  • The target must mark an additional Hit Point.

You can’t choose the same option more than once.
Champion_s_Edge:Clear 1 HP.name: Clear 1 HP

Champion_s_Edge:Clear 1 Armor Slot.description: Plant a precise strike. Spend 1 Hope to deal d6 damage
Champion_s_Edge:Clear 1 Armor Slot.name: Clear 1 Armor Slot

Champion_s_Edge:Deal 1 HP Damage.description: Lash out with a flash of steel. Spend 1 Hope to deal d6 Physical damage
Champion_s_Edge:Deal 1 HP Damage.name: Deal 1 HP Damage

Chokehold:Pull into Chokehold.description: When you position yourself behind a creature who’s about your size, you can mark a Stress to pull them into a chokehold, making them temporarily Vulnerable.
Chokehold:Pull into Chokehold.name: Pull into Chokehold

Chokehold:Damage.description: When a creature attacks a target who is Vulnerable in this way, they deal an extra 2d6 damage.
Chokehold:Damage.name: Damage

Cinder_Grasp:Cast.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Melee range. On a success, the target instantly bursts into flames, takes 1d20+3 magic damage, and is temporarily lit On Fire.
Cinder_Grasp:Cast.name: Cast

Cinder_Grasp:On Fire: Damage.description: When a creature acts while On Fire, they must take an extra 2d6 magic damage if they are still On Fire at the end of their action.
Cinder_Grasp:On Fire: Damage.name: On Fire: Damage

Cloaking_Blast.description: Let loose a flare of power. Become Cloaked. Spend 1 Hope
Cloaking_Blast.name: Become Cloaked

Codex_Touched:Mark Stress.description: You can mark a Stress to add your Proficiency to a Spellcast Roll.
Codex_Touched:Mark Stress.name: Mark Stress

Codex_Touched:Replace Card.description: Once per rest, replace this card with any card from your vault without paying its Recall Cost.
Codex_Touched:Replace Card.name: Replace Card

Confusing_Aura:Create First Layer.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (14). Once per long rest on a success, you create a layer of illusion over your body that makes it hard to tell exactly where you are.
Confusing_Aura:Create First Layer.name: Create First Layer

Confusing_Aura:Create Extra Layers.description: Mark any number of Stress to make that many additional layers.
Confusing_Aura:Create Extra Layers.name: Create Extra Layers

Conjured_Steeds.description: Spend any number of Hope to conjure that many magical steeds (such as horses, camels, or elephants) that you and your allies can ride until your next long rest or the steeds take any damage. The steeds double your land speed while traveling and, when in danger, allow you to move within Far range without having to roll. Creatures riding a steed gain a −2 penalty to attack rolls and a +2 bonus to damage rolls.
Conjured_Steeds.name: Conjure

Conjure_Swarm:Tekaira's Armored Beetles:.description: Tekaira Armored Beetles: Mark a Stress to conjure armored beetles that encircle you. When you next take damage, reduce the severity by one threshold.
Conjure_Swarm:Tekaira's Armored Beetles:.name: Tekaira's Armored Beetles: Stress

Conjure_Swarm:Keep Beetles.description: You can spend a Hope to keep the beetles conjured after taking damage.
Conjure_Swarm:Keep Beetles.name: Keep Beetles

Conjure_Swarm:Fire Flies: Cast.description: Fire Flies: Make a Spellcast Roll against all adversaries within Close range. Spend a Hope to deal 2d8+3 magic damage to targets you succeeded against.
Conjure_Swarm:Fire Flies: Cast.name: Fire Flies: Cast

Copycat.description: Once per long rest, this card can mimic the features of another domain card of level 8 or lower in another player’s loadout. Spend Hope equal to half the card’s level to gain access to the feature. It lasts until your next rest or they place the card in their vault.
Copycat.name: Mimic

Corrosive_Projectile:Cast.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Far range. On a success, deal d6+4 magic damage using your Proficiency.
Corrosive_Projectile:Cast.name: Cast

Corrosive_Projectile:Corrode.description: Additionally, mark 2 or more Stress to make them permanently Corroded. While a target is Corroded, they gain a −1 penalty to their Difficulty for every 2 Stress you spent. This condition can stack.
Corrosive_Projectile:Corrode.name: Corrode

Counterspell.description: You can interrupt a magical effect taking place by making a reaction roll using your Spellcast trait. On a success, the effect stops and any consequences are avoided, and this card is placed in your vault.
Counterspell.name: Interrupt

Critical_Inspiration.description: Once per rest, when you critically succeed on an attack, all allies within Very Close range can clear a Stress or gain a Hope.
Critical_Inspiration.name: Critically Succeed

Dark_Whispers.description: Barrel in like a raging bull. Ask A Question. Mark 1 Stress
Dark_Whispers.name: Ask a question

Deadly_Focus.description: Once per rest, you can apply all your focus toward a target of your choice. Until you attack another creature, you defeat the target, or the battle ends, gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency.
Deadly_Focus.name: Focus

Deathrun.description:
Spend 3 Hope to run a straight path through the battlefield to a point within Far range, making an attack against all adversaries within your weapon’s range along that path. Choose the order in which you deal damage to the targets you succeeded against. For the first, roll your weapon damage with a +1 bonus to your Proficiency. Then remove a die from your damage roll and deal the remaining damage to the next target. Continue to remove a die for each subsequent target until you have no more damage dice or adversaries.

You can’t target the same adversary more than once per attack.
Deathrun.name: Spend Hope

Death_Grip:Pull.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Close range, and choose the following option:

  • You pull the target into Melee range or pull yourself into Melee range of them.

On a success, vines reach out from your hands, causing the chosen effect and temporarily Restraining the target.
Death_Grip:Pull.name: Pull

Death_Grip:Constrict.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Close range and choose the following option:

  • You constrict the target and force them to mark 2 Stress.

On a success, vines reach out from your hands, causing the chosen effect and temporarily Restraining the target.
Death_Grip:Constrict.name: Constrict

Death_Grip:Hit All Adversaries Between.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Close range and choose the following option:

  • All adversaries between you and the target must succeed on a Reaction Roll (13) or be hit by vines, taking 3d6+2 physical damage.

On a success, vines reach out from your hands, causing the chosen effect and temporarily Restraining the target.
Death_Grip:Hit All Adversaries Between.name: Hit All Adversaries Between

Deft_Deceiver.description: Spend a Hope to gain advantage on a roll to deceive or trick someone into believing a lie you tell them
Deft_Deceiver.name: Gain Advantage

Deft_Maneuvers.description:
Once per rest, mark a Stress to sprint anywhere within Far range without making an Agility Roll to get there.

If you end this movement within Melee range of an adversary and immediately make an attack against them, gain a +1 bonus to the attack roll.
Deft_Maneuvers.name: Mark Stress

Disintegration_Wave.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (18). Once per long rest on a success, the GM tells you which adversaries within Far range have a Difficulty of 18 or lower. Mark a Stress for each one you wish to hit with this spell. They are killed and can’t come back to life by any means.
Disintegration_Wave.name: Spellcast Roll

Divination.description: Once per long rest, spend 3 Hope to reach out to the forces beyond and ask one “yes or no” question about an event, person, place, or situation in the near future. For a moment, the present falls away and you see the answer before you.
Divination.name: Ask one Question

Earthquake.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll (16). Once per rest on a success, all targets within Very Far range who aren’t flying must make a Reaction Roll (18). Targets who fail take 3d10+8 physical damage and are temporarily Vulnerable. Targets who succeed take half damage.

Additionally, when you succeed on the Spellcast Roll, all terrain within Very Far range becomes difficult to move through and structures within this range might sustain damage or crumble.
Earthquake.name: Cast

Eclipse:Cast.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (16). Once per long rest on a success, plunge the entire area within Far range into complete darkness only you and your allies can see through. Attack rolls have disadvantage when targeting you or an ally within this shadow.
Eclipse:Cast.name: Cast

Eclipse:Target Marks Stress.description: Drive home a vicious sweep. Target Marks Stress. deal d6 damage
Eclipse:Target Marks Stress.name: Target Marks Stress

Encore.description: Channel a surge of will. Repeat Attack. trigger the effect
Encore.name: Repeat Attack

Endless_Charisma.description: After you make an action roll to persuade, lie, or garner favor, you can spend a Hope to reroll the Hope or Fear Die.
Endless_Charisma.name: Spend Hope to Reroll

Enrapture:Enrapture.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Close range. On a success, they become temporarily Enraptured. While Enraptured, a target’s attention is fixed on you, narrowing their field of view and drowning out any sound but your voice.
Enrapture:Enrapture.name: Enrapture

Enrapture:Mark Stress.description: Once per rest on a success, you can mark a Stress to force the Enraptured target to mark a Stress as well.
Enrapture:Mark Stress.name: Mark Stress

Falling_Sky.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll against all adversaries within Far range. Mark any number of Stress to make shards of arcana rain down from above. Targets you succeed against take 1d20+2 magic damage for each Stress marked.

@Template[type:emanation|range:f]
Falling_Sky.name: Attack

Ferocity.description: When you cause an adversary to mark 1 or more Hit Points, you can spend 2 Hope to increase your Evasion by the number of Hit Points they marked. This bonus lasts until after the next attack made against you.
Ferocity.name: Spend Hope

Final_Words.description: Lash out with a flash of steel. Infuse Corpse. trigger the effect
Final_Words.name: Infuse Corpse

Flight:Cast.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (15). On a success, place a number of tokens equal to your Agility on this card (minimum 1).
Flight:Cast.name: Cast

Flight:Spend Token.description: When you make an action roll while flying, spend a token from this card. After the action that spends the last token is resolved, you descend to the ground directly below you.
Flight:Spend Token.name: Spend Token

Floating_Eye.description: Spend a Hope to create a single, small floating orb that you can move anywhere within Very Far range. While this spell is active, you can see through the orb as though you’re looking out from its position. You can transition between using your own senses and seeing through the orb freely. If the orb takes damage or moves out of range, the spell ends.
Floating_Eye.name: Create Orb

Forager:3. Arcane Rune (Spellcast Roll).description: 1. An arcane rune (+2 to a Spellcast Roll)
Forager:3. Arcane Rune (Spellcast Roll).name: 3. Arcane Rune (Spellcast Roll)

Forceful_Push.description:
Make an attack with your primary weapon against a target within Melee range. On a success, you deal damage and knock them back to Close range. On a success with Hope, add a d6 to your damage roll.

Additionally, you can spend a Hope to make them temporarily Vulnerable.
Forceful_Push.name: Spend Hope

Force_of_Nature:Transform.description:
Mark a Stress to transform into a hulking nature spirit, gaining the following benefits:

  • When you succeed on an attack or Spellcast Roll, gain a +10 bonus to the damage roll.

  • When you deal enough damage to defeat a creature within Close range, you absorb them and clear an Armor Slot.

  • You can’t be Restrained.

Before you make an action roll, you must spend a Hope. If you can’t, you revert to your normal form.
Force_of_Nature:Transform.name: Transform

Force_of_Nature:Spend Hope for Action.description: Before you make an action roll, you must spend a Hope. If you can’t, you revert to your normal form.
Force_of_Nature:Spend Hope for Action.name: Spend Hope for Action

Forest_Sprites.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll (13). On a success, spend any number of Hope to create an equal number of small forest sprites who appear at points you choose within Far range, providing the following benefits:

  • Your allies gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls against adversaries within Melee range of a sprite.

  • An ally who marks an Armor Slot while within Melee range of a sprite can mark an additional Armor Slot.

A sprite vanishes after granting a benefit or taking any damage.
Forest_Sprites.name: Cast

Frenzy.description: Let loose a flare of power. Frenzy. trigger the effect
Frenzy.name: Frenzy

Full_Surge.description: Once per long rest, mark 3 Stress to push your body to its limits. Gain a +2 bonus to all of your character traits until your next rest.
Full_Surge.name: Mark Stress

Gifted_Tracker.description:
When you’re tracking a specific creature or group of creatures based on signs of their passage, you can spend any number of Hope and ask the GM that many questions from the following list.

  • What direction did they go?
  • How long ago did they pass through?
  • What were they doing in this location?
  • How many of them were here?

When you encounter creatures you’ve tracked in this way, gain a +1 bonus to your Evasion against them.
Gifted_Tracker.name: Ask Questions

Glancing_Blow.description: When you fail an attack, you can mark a Stress to deal weapon damage using half your Proficiency.
Glancing_Blow.name: Mark a Stress

Glyph_of_Nightfall.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Very Close range. On a success, spend a Hope to conjure a dark glyph upon their body that exposes their weak points, temporarily reducing the target’s Difficulty by a value equal to your Knowledge (minimum 1).
Glyph_of_Nightfall.name: Cast

Goad_Them_On.description: Describe how you taunt a target within Close range, then make a Presence Roll against them. On a success, the target must mark a Stress, and the next time the GM spotlights them, they must target you with an attack, which they make with disadvantage.
Goad_Them_On.name: Goad

Gore_and_Glory:Clear Stress.description:
When you critically succeed on a weapon attack, gain an additional Hope or clear an additional Stress.

Additionally, when you deal enough damage to defeat an enemy, gain a Hope or clear a Stress.
Gore_and_Glory:Clear Stress.name: Clear Stress

Gore_and_Glory:Gain Hope.description:
When you critically succeed on a weapon attack, gain an additional Hope or clear an additional Stress.

Additionally, when you deal enough damage to defeat an enemy, gain a Hope or clear a Stress.
Gore_and_Glory:Gain Hope.name: Gain Hope

Grace_Touched:Mark Armor Slot.description: Lash out with a flash of steel. Mark Armor Slot. Spend 1 Armor
Grace_Touched:Mark Armor Slot.name: Mark Armor Slot

Grace_Touched:Mark 1 Stress.description: Barrel in like a raging bull. Mark 1 Stress. deal d6 damage
Grace_Touched:Mark 1 Stress.name: Mark 1 Stress

Ground_Pound.description:
Spend 2 Hope to strike the ground where you stand and make a Strength Roll against all targets within Very Close range. Targets you succeed against are thrown back to Far range and must make a Reaction Roll (17). Targets who fail take 4d10+8 damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

@Template[type:emanation|range:vc]
Ground_Pound.name: Strike Ground

Healing_Field:Heal 1 Hit Point.description:
Once per long rest, you can conjure a field of healing plants around you. Everywhere within Close range of you bursts to life with vibrant nature, allowing you and all allies in the area to clear a Hit Point.

Spend 2 Hope to allow you and all allies to clear 2 Hit Points instead.
Healing_Field:Heal 1 Hit Point.name: Heal 1 Hit Point

Healing_Field:Heal 2 Hit Points.description:
Once per long rest, you can conjure a field of healing plants around you. Everywhere within Close range of you bursts to life with vibrant nature, allowing you and all allies in the area to clear a Hit Point.

Spend 2 Hope to allow you and all allies to clear 2 Hit Points instead.
Healing_Field:Heal 2 Hit Points.name: Heal 2 Hit Points

Healing_Hands:Cast.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (13) and target a creature other than yourself within Melee range.
Healing_Hands:Cast.name: Cast

Healing_Hands:Heal One Hit Point.description: On a failure, mark a Stress to clear a Hit Point or a Stress on the target. You can’t heal the same target again until your next long rest.
Healing_Hands:Heal One Hit Point.name: Heal One Hit Point

Healing_Hands:Heal Two Hit Points.description: On a success, mark a Stress to clear 2 Hit Points or 2 Stress on the target. You can’t heal the same target again until your next long rest.
Healing_Hands:Heal Two Hit Points.name: Heal Two Hit Points

Healing_Hands:Heal One Stress.description: On a failure, mark a Stress to clear a Hit Point or a Stress on the target. You can’t heal the same target again until your next long rest.
Healing_Hands:Heal One Stress.name: Heal One Stress

Healing_Hands:Heal Two Stress.description: On a success, mark a Stress to clear 2 Hit Points or 2 Stress on the target. You can’t heal the same target again until your next long rest.
Healing_Hands:Heal Two Stress.name: Heal Two Stress

Healing_Strike.description: When you deal damage to an adversary, you can spend 2 Hope to clear a Hit Point on an ally within Close range.
Healing_Strike.name: Clear Hit Point

Hold_the_Line:Spend Hope.description:
Describe the defensive stance you take and spend a Hope. If an adversary moves within Very Close range, they’re pulled into Melee range and Restrained.

This condition lasts until you move or fail a roll with Fear, or the GM spends 2 Fear on their turn to clear it.
Hold_the_Line:Spend Hope.name: Spend Hope

Hold_the_Line:Restrain.description: If an adversary moves within Very Close range, they’re pulled into Melee range and Restrained.
Hold_the_Line:Restrain.name: Restrain

Hush.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Close range. On a success, spend a Hope to conjure suppressive magic around the target that encompasses everything within Very Close range of them and follows them as they move.

The target and anything within the area is Silenced until the GM spends a Fear on their turn to clear this condition, you cast Hush again, or you take Major damage. While Silenced, they can’t make noise and can’t cast spells.
Hush.name: Cast

Hypnotic_Shimmer.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against all adversaries in front of you within Close range. Once per rest on a success, create an illusion of flashing colors and lights that temporarily Stuns targets you succeed against and forces them to mark a Stress. While Stunned, they can’t use reactions and can’t take any other actions until they clear this condition.
Hypnotic_Shimmer.name: Cast

Inspirational_Words:Clear Stress.description:
Spend a token from this card to give them the following:

  • Your ally clears a Stress.
Inspirational_Words:Clear Stress.name: Clear Stress

Inspirational_Words:Clear Hitpoint.description:
Spend a token from this card to give them the following:

  • Your ally clears a Hit Point.
Inspirational_Words:Clear Hitpoint.name: Clear Hitpoint

Inspirational_Words:Give Hope.description:
Spend a token from this card to give them the following:

  • Your ally gains a Hope.
Inspirational_Words:Give Hope.name: Give Hope

Invigoration.description: When you or an ally within Close range has used a feature that has an exhaustion limit (such as once per rest or once per session), you can spend any number of Hope and roll that many d6s. If any roll a 6, the feature can be used again.
Invigoration.name: Roll Dice Pool

Invisibility.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll (10). On a success, mark a Stress and choose yourself or an ally within Melee range to become Invisible. An Invisible creature can’t be seen except through magical means and attack rolls against them are made with disadvantage. Place a number of tokens on this card equal to your Spellcast trait. When the Invisible creature takes an action, spend a token from this card. After the action that spends the last token is resolved, the effect ends.

You can only hold Invisibility on one creature at a time.
Invisibility.name: Cast

I_Am_Your_Shield.description: When an ally within Very Close range would take damage, you can mark a Stress to stand in the way and make yourself the target of the attack instead. When you take damage from this attack, you can mark any number of Armor Slots.
I_Am_Your_Shield.name: Mark Stress

I_See_It_Coming.description: When you’re targeted by an attack made from beyond Melee range, you can mark a Stress to roll a d4 and gain a bonus to your Evasion equal to the result against the attack.
I_See_It_Coming.name: Roll d4

Know_Thy_Enemy:Instinct Roll.description:
When observing a creature, you can make an Instinct Roll against them. On a success, spend a Hope and ask the GM for one set of information about the target from the following options:

  • Their unmarked Hit Points and Stress.

  • Their Difficulty and damage thresholds.

  • Their tactics and standard attack damage dice.

  • Their features and Experiences.
Know_Thy_Enemy:Instinct Roll.name: Instinct Roll

Know_Thy_Enemy:Mark Stress.description: On a success, you can mark a Stress to remove a Fear from the GM’s Fear Pool.
Know_Thy_Enemy:Mark Stress.name: Mark Stress

Lead_by_Example.description: When you deal damage to an adversary, you can mark a Stress and describe how you encourage your allies. The next PC to make an attack against that adversary can clear a Stress or gain a Hope.
Lead_by_Example.name: Mark Stress

Lean_on_Me.description: Once per long rest, when you console or inspire an ally who failed an action roll, you can both clear 2 Stress.
Lean_on_Me.name: Healing

Life_Ward.description:
Spend 3 Hope and choose an ally within Close range. They are marked with a glowing sigil of protection. When this ally would make a death move, they clear a Hit Point instead.

This effect ends when it saves the target from a death move, you cast Life Ward on another target, or you take a long rest.
Life_Ward.name: Mark with Sigil

Manifest_Wall.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll (15). Once per rest on a success, spend a Hope to create a temporary magical wall between two points within Far range. It can be up to 50 feet high and form at any angle. Creatures or objects in its path are shunted to a side of your choice. The wall stays up until your next rest or you cast Manifest Wall again.

@Template[type:ray|range:f]
Manifest_Wall.name: Spend Hope

Mass_Disguise.description:
When you have a few minutes of silence to focus, you can mark a Stress to change the appearance of all willing creatures within Close range. Their new forms must share a general body structure and size, and can be somebody or something you’ve seen before or entirely fabricated. A disguised creature has advantage on Presence Rolls to avoid scrutiny.

Activate a Countdown (8). It ticks down as a consequence the GM chooses. When it triggers, the disguise drops.
Mass_Disguise.name: Cast

Mass_Enrapture:Enrapture.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll against all targets within Far range. Targets you succeed against become temporarily Enraptured. While Enraptured, a target’s attention is fixed on you, narrowing their field of view and drowning out any sound but your voice. Mark a Stress to force all Enraptured targets to mark a Stress, ending this spell.

@Template[type:emanation|range:f]
Mass_Enrapture:Enrapture.name: Enrapture

Mass_Enrapture:Mark Stress.description: Mark a Stress to force all Enraptured targets to mark a Stress, ending this spell.
Mass_Enrapture:Mark Stress.name: Mark Stress

Mending_Touch:Heal One Hitpoint.description: When you can take a few minutes to focus on the target you’re helping, you can spend 2 Hope to clear a Hit Point or a Stress on them.
Mending_Touch:Heal One Hitpoint.name: Heal One Hitpoint

Mending_Touch:Heal One Stress.description: Unleash a storm of force. Heal One Stress. Spend 2 Hope to deal d6 damage
Mending_Touch:Heal One Stress.name: Heal One Stress

Mending_Touch:Heal Two Hit Points.description:
When you can take a few minutes to focus on the target you’re helping, you can spend 2 Hope to clear a Hit Point or a Stress on them.

Once per long rest, when you spend this healing time learning something new about them or revealing something about yourself, you can clear 2 Hit Points or 2 Stress on them instead.
Mending_Touch:Heal Two Hit Points.name: Heal Two Hit Points

Mending_Touch:Heal Two Stress.description:
When you can take a few minutes to focus on the target you’re helping, you can spend 2 Hope to clear a Hit Point or a Stress on them.

Once per long rest, when you spend this healing time learning something new about them or revealing something about yourself, you can clear 2 Hit Points or 2 Stress on them instead.
Mending_Touch:Heal Two Stress.name: Heal Two Stress

Midnight_Spirit:Summon Spirit.description: Spend a Hope to summon a humanoid-sized spirit that can move or carry things for you until your next rest.
Midnight_Spirit:Summon Spirit.name: Summon Spirit

Midnight_Spirit:Attack Adversary.description: You can also send it to attack an adversary. When you do, make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Very Far range. On a success, the spirit moves into Melee range with that target. Roll a number of d6s equal to your Spellcast trait and deal that much magic damage to the target. The spirit then dissipates. You can only have one spirit at a time.
Midnight_Spirit:Attack Adversary.name: Attack Adversary

Midnight_Touched:Gain Hope.description: Once per rest, when you have 0 Hope and the GM would gain a Fear, you can gain a Hope instead.
Midnight_Touched:Gain Hope.name: Gain Hope

Midnight_Touched:Mark Stress.description: When you make a successful attack, you can mark a Stress to add the result of your Fear Die to your damage roll.
Midnight_Touched:Mark Stress.name: Mark Stress

Natural_Familiar:Summon Familiar.description: Spend a Hope to summon a small nature spirit or forest critter to your side until your next rest, you cast Natural Familiar again, or the familiar is targeted by an attack. If you spend an additional Hope, you can summon a familiar that flies.
Natural_Familiar:Summon Familiar.name: Summon Familiar

Natural_Familiar:Perform Task.description: You can communicate with them, make a Spellcast Roll to command them to perform simple tasks.
Natural_Familiar:Perform Task.name: Perform Task

Natural_Familiar:See Through Eyes.description: Mark a Stress to see through their eyes.
Natural_Familiar:See Through Eyes.name: See Through Eyes

Nature_s_Tongue:Speak with Nature.description: You can speak the language of the natural world. When you want to speak to the plants and animals around you, make an Instinct Roll (12). On a success, they’ll give you the information they know. On a roll with Fear, their knowledge might be limited or come at a cost.
Nature_s_Tongue:Speak with Nature.name: Speak with Nature

Nature_s_Tongue:Gain Bonus.description: Additionally, before you make a Spellcast Roll while within a natural environment, you can spend a Hope to gain a +2 bonus to the roll.
Nature_s_Tongue:Gain Bonus.name: Gain Bonus

Never_Upstaged:Mark Stress (1 token).description: When you mark 1 or more Hit Points from an attack, you can mark a Stress to place a number of tokens equal to the number of Hit Points you marked on this card. On your next successful attack, gain a +5 bonus to your damage roll for each token on this card, then clear all tokens.
Never_Upstaged:Mark Stress (1 token).name: Mark Stress (1 token)

Never_Upstaged:Mark Stress (2 tokens).description: When you mark 1 or more Hit Points from an attack, you can mark a Stress to place a number of tokens equal to the number of Hit Points you marked on this card. On your next successful attack, gain a +5 bonus to your damage roll for each token on this card, then clear all tokens.
Never_Upstaged:Mark Stress (2 tokens).name: Mark Stress (2 tokens)

Never_Upstaged:Mark Stress (3 tokens).description: When you mark 1 or more Hit Points from an attack, you can mark a Stress to place a number of tokens equal to the number of Hit Points you marked on this card. On your next successful attack, gain a +5 bonus to your damage roll for each token on this card, then clear all tokens.
Never_Upstaged:Mark Stress (3 tokens).name: Mark Stress (3 tokens)

Never_Upstaged:Mark Stress (4 tokens).description: When you mark 1 or more Hit Points from an attack, you can mark a Stress to place a number of tokens equal to the number of Hit Points you marked on this card. On your next successful attack, gain a +5 bonus to your damage roll for each token on this card, then clear all tokens.
Never_Upstaged:Mark Stress (4 tokens).name: Mark Stress (4 tokens)

Night_Terror:Horrify.description:
Once per long rest, choose any targets within Very Close range to perceive you as a nightmarish horror. The targets must succeed on a Reaction Roll (16) or become temporarily Horrified. While Horrified, they’re Vulnerable. Steal a number of Fear from the GM equal to the number of targets that are Horrified (up to the number of Fear in the GM’s pool). Roll a number of d6s equal to the number of stolen Fear and deal the total damage to each Horrified target. Discard the stolen Fear.

@Template[type:emanation|range:vc]
Night_Terror:Horrify.name: Horrify

Night_Terror:Steal Fear.description: Steal a number of Fear from the GM equal to the number of targets that are Horrified (up to the number of Fear in the GM’s pool). Roll a number of d6s equal to the number of stolen Fear and deal the total damage to each Horrified target. Discard the stolen Fear.
Night_Terror:Steal Fear.name: Steal Fear

Notorious.description:
When you leverage your notoriety to get what you want, you can mark a Stress before you roll to gain a +10 bonus to the result.

This card doesn’t count against your loadout’s domain card maximum of 5 and can’t be placed in your vault.
Notorious.name: Gain Bonus

Onslaught.description:
When you successfully make an attack with your weapon, you never deal damage beneath a target’s Major damage threshold (the target always marks a minimum of 2 Hit Points).

Additionally, when a creature within your weapon’s range deals damage to an ally with an attack that doesn’t include you, you can mark a Stress to force them to make a Reaction Roll (15). On a failure, the target must mark a Hit Point.
Onslaught.name: Mark a Stress

Overwhelming_Aura.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (15) to magically empower your aura. On a success, spend 2 Hope to make your Presence equal to your Spellcast trait until your next long rest.While this spell is active, an adversary must mark a Stress when they target you with an attack.
Overwhelming_Aura.name: Cast

Phantom_Retreat:Activate.description: Spend a Hope to activate Phantom Retreat where you’re currently standing.
Phantom_Retreat:Activate.name: Activate

Phantom_Retreat:Retreat.description: Spend another Hope at any time before your next rest to disappear from where you are and reappear where you were standing when you activated Phantom Retreat. This spell ends after you reappear.
Phantom_Retreat:Retreat.name: Retreat

Plant_Dominion.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (18). Once per long rest on a success, you reshape the natural world, changing the surrounding plant life anywhere within Far range of you. For example, you can grow trees instantly, clear a path through dense vines, or create a wall of roots.
Plant_Dominion.name: Reshape Natural World

Premonition.description: Once per long rest, immediately after the GM conveys the consequences of a roll you made, you can rescind the move and consequences like they never happened and make another move instead.
Premonition.name: Rescind Move

Preservation_Blast.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against all targets within Melee range. Targets you succeed against are forced back to Far range and take d8+3 magic damage using your Spellcast trait.
Preservation_Blast.name: Cast

Rage_Up:Mark 1 Stress.description: Barrel in like a raging bull. Mark 1 Stress. Mark 1 Stress
Rage_Up:Mark 1 Stress.name: Mark 1 Stress

Rage_Up:Mark 2 Stress.description: Slip in a cutting remark. Mark 2 Stress. Mark 2 Stress
Rage_Up:Mark 2 Stress.name: Mark 2 Stress

Rain_of_Blades:Cast.description: Spend a Hope to make a Spellcast Roll and conjure throwing blades that strike out at all targets within Very Close range. Targets you succeed against take d8+2 magic damage using your Proficiency.
Rain_of_Blades:Cast.name: Cast

Rain_of_Blades:Damage Against Vulnerable.description: If a target you hit is Vulnerable, they take an extra 1d8 damage.
Rain_of_Blades:Damage Against Vulnerable.name: Damage Against Vulnerable

Rapid_Riposte.description: When an attack made against you from within Melee range fails, you can mark a Stress and seize the opportunity to deal the weapon damage of one of your active weapons to the attacker.
Rapid_Riposte.name: Mark Stress

Reaper_s_Strike.description: Once per long rest, spend a Hope to make an attack roll. The GM tells you which targets within range it would succeed against. Choose one of these targets and force them to mark 5 Hit Points.
Reaper_s_Strike.name: Spend a Hope

Reassurance.description: Once per rest, after an ally attempts an action roll but before the consequences take place, you can offer assistance or words of support. When you do, your ally can reroll their dice.
Reassurance.name: Reassure

Reckless.description: Mark a Stress to gain advantage on an attack.
Reckless.name: Mark a Stress

Recovery.description: During a short rest, you can choose a long rest downtime move instead. You can spend a Hope to let an ally do the same.
Recovery.name: Spend Hope

Redirect.description: When an attack made against you from beyond Melee range fails, roll a number of d6s equal to your Proficiency. If any roll a 6, you can mark a Stress to redirect the attack to damage an adversary within Very Close range instead.
Redirect.name: Mark Stress

Rejuvenation_Barrier.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll (15). Once per rest on a success, create a temporary barrier of protective energy around you at Very Close range. You and all allies within the barrier when this spell is cast clear 1d4 Hit Points. While the barrier is up, you and all allies within have resistance to physical damage from outside the barrier.

When you move, the barrier follows you.

@Template[type:emanation|range:vc]
Rejuvenation_Barrier.name: Cast

Restoration:Heal Hitpoints.description: Touch a creature and spend any number of tokens to clear 2 Hit Points or 2 Stress for each token spent.
Restoration:Heal Hitpoints.name: Heal Hitpoints

Restoration:Reduce Stress.description: Touch a creature and spend any number of tokens to clear 2 Hit Points or 2 Stress for each token spent.
Restoration:Reduce Stress.name: Reduce Stress

Restoration:Remove Condition.description: You can also spend a token from this card when touching a creature to clear the Vulnerable condition or heal a physical or magical ailment (the GM might require additional tokens depending on the strength of the ailment).
Restoration:Remove Condition.name: Remove Condition

Resurrection:Cast.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (20). On a success, restore one creature who has been dead no longer than 100 years to full strength.
Resurrection:Cast.name: Cast

Resurrection:Keep Card.description: Then roll a d6. On a result of 5 or lower, place this card in your vault permanently. On a failure, you can’t cast Resurrection again for a week.
Resurrection:Keep Card.name: Keep Card

Rift_Walker.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll (15). On a success, you place an arcane marking on the ground where you currently stand. The next time you successfully cast Rift Walker, a rift in space opens up, providing safe passage back to the exact spot where the marking was placed. This rift stays open until you choose to close it or you cast another spell.

You can drop the spell at any time to cast Rift Walker again and place the marking somewhere new.
Rift_Walker.name: Cast

Rise_Up.description: When you mark 1 or more Hit Points from an attack, clear a Stress.
Rise_Up.name: Clear Stress

Rousing_Strike.description: Once per rest, when you critically succeed on an attack, you and all allies who can see or hear you can clear a Hit Point or 1d4 Stress.
Rousing_Strike.name: Critically Succeed

Rune_Ward.description:
The ward’s holder can spend a Hope to reduce incoming damage by 1d8.

If the Ward Die result is 8, the ward’s power ends after it reduces damage this turn. It can be recharged for free on your next rest.
Rune_Ward.name: Reduce Damage

Safe_Haven.description:
When you have a few minutes of calm to focus, you can spend 2 Hope to summon your Safe Haven, a large interdimensional home where you and your allies can take shelter. When you do, a magical door appears somewhere within Close range. Only creatures of your choice can enter. Once inside, you can make the entrance invisible. You and anyone else inside can always exit. Once you leave, the doorway must be summoned again.

When you take a rest within your own Safe Haven, you can choose an additional downtime move.
Safe_Haven.name: Spend Hope

Sage_Touched:Double Agility.description: Once per rest, you can double your Agility or Instinct when making a roll that uses that trait. You must choose to do this before you roll.
Sage_Touched:Double Agility.name: Double Agility

Sage_Touched:Double Instinct.description: Once per rest, you can double your Agility or Instinct when making a roll that uses that trait. You must choose to do this before you roll.
Sage_Touched:Double Instinct.name: Double Instinct

Salvation_Beam.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (16). On a success, mark any number of Stress to target a line of allies within Far range. You can clear Hit Points on the targets equal to the number of Stress marked, divided among them however you’d like.
Salvation_Beam.name: Cast

Scramble.description: Once per rest, when a creature within Melee range would deal damage to you, you can avoid the attack and safely move out of Melee range of the enemy.
Scramble.name: Avoid

Second_Wind:Clear Three Stress.description: Once per rest, when you succeed on an attack against an adversary, you can clear 3 Stress or a Hit Point. On a success with Hope, you also clear 3 Stress or a Hit Point on an ally within Close range of you.
Second_Wind:Clear Three Stress.name: Clear Three Stress

Second_Wind:Clear Hit Point.description: Once per rest, when you succeed on an attack against an adversary, you can clear 3 Stress or a Hit Point. On a success with Hope, you also clear 3 Stress or a Hit Point on an ally within Close range of you.
Second_Wind:Clear Hit Point.name: Clear Hit Point

Sensory_Projection.description: Spin up a burst of speed. Cast. trigger the effect
Sensory_Projection.name: Cast

Shadowbind.description:
Make a Spellcast Roll against all adversaries within Very Close range. Targets you succeed against are temporarily Restrained as their shadow binds them in place.

@Template[type:emanation|range:vc]
Shadowbind.name: Cast

Shape_Material.description:
Spend a Hope to shape a section of natural material you’re touching (such as stone, ice, or wood) to suit your purpose. The area of the material can be no larger than you. For example, you can form a rudimentary tool or create a door.

You can only affect the material within Close range of where you’re touching it.
Shape_Material.name: Shape

Share_the_Burden.description: Once per rest, take on the Stress from a willing creature within Melee range. The target describes what intimate knowledge or emotions telepathically leak from their mind in this moment between you. Transfer any number of their marked Stress to you, then gain a Hope for each Stress transferred.
Share_the_Burden.name: Take Stress

Shield_Aura.description:
Mark a Stress to cast a protective aura on a target within Very Close range. When the target marks an Armor Slot, they reduce the severity of the attack by an additional threshold. If this spell causes a creature who would be damaged to instead mark no Hit Points, the effect ends.

You can only hold Shield Aura on one creature at a time.
Shield_Aura.name: Cast Protective Aura

Shrug_It_Off.description: When you would take damage, you can mark a Stress to reduce the severity of the damage by one threshold. When you do, roll a d6. On a result of 3 or lower, place this card in your vault.
Shrug_It_Off.name: Roll d6

Sigil_of_Retribution.description: Mark an adversary within Close range with a sigil of retribution. The GM gains a Fear. When the marked adversary deals damage to you or your allies, place a d8 on this card. You can hold a number of d8s equal to your level. When you successfully attack the marked adversary, roll the dice on this card and add the total to your damage roll, then clear the dice. This effect ends when the marked adversary is defeated or you cast Sigil of Retribution again.
Sigil_of_Retribution.name: Mark

Smite.description: Once per rest, spend 3 Hope to charge your powerful smite. When you next successfully attack with a weapon, double the result of your damage roll. This attack deals magic damage regardless of the weapon’s damage type.
Smite.name: Charge Smite

Soothing_Speech:Heal Another.description: During a short rest, when you take the time to comfort another character while using the Tend to Wounds downtime move on them, clear an additional Hit Point on that character.
Soothing_Speech:Heal Another.name: Heal Another

Soothing_Speech:Heal Self.description: When you do, you also clear 2 Hit Points.
Soothing_Speech:Heal Self.name: Heal Self

Specter_of_the_Dark.description: Mark a Stress to become Spectral until you make an action roll targeting another creature. While Spectral, you’re immune to physical damage and can float and pass through solid objects. Other creatures can still see you while you’re in this form.
Specter_of_the_Dark.name: Become Spectral

Spellcharge.description: When you make a successful attack against a target, you can spend any number of tokens to add a d6 for each token spent to your damage roll.
Spellcharge.name: Spend Tokens

Splintering_Strike.description: Spend a Hope and make an attack against all adversaries within your weapon’s range. Once per long rest, on a success against any targets, add up the damage dealt, then redistribute that damage however you wish between the targets you succeeded against. When you deal damage to a target, roll an additional damage die and add its result to the damage you deal to that target.
Splintering_Strike.name: Spend Hope

Stealth_Expertise.description: Deliver a clean blow. Mark 1 Stress to range close
Stealth_Expertise.name: Change Fear to Hope

Strategic_Approach.description:
The first time you move within Close range of an adversary and make an attack against them, you can spend one token to choose one of the following options:

  • You make the attack with advantage.
